meta.title: Sweet Potato Chili
meta.description: This hearty soup is great for a chilly fall day!

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.notes: Olive oil is preferable, but any vegetable oil will work fine.

steps.instructions: Peel 1 sweet potato and cut it into 1/2 inch cubes.

steps.caption: make a batter
steps.instructions: Heat about 2 tbsp. oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat. When it is hot, add the sweet potato and onion. Cook until the onion begins to soften, stirring occasionally.

steps.caption: add seasoning
steps.instructions: Add 1 tbsp. garlic, 2 tbsp. chili powder, and 1 tbsp. cumin, and cook for about 30 seconds, stirring constantly.

steps.caption: cut cauliflower
steps.instructions: Add 2 cups water, and bring to a simmer.

steps.caption: bake
steps.instructions: When the chili begins to simmer, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and cook for 10 minutes. By this time, the sweet potato should be soft.

steps.caption: batter the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Drain the liquid from 2 cans of beans and 1 can of diced tomatoes, and add them to the chili. Increase the heat to high and cook until the chili has thickened, stirring occasionally.

steps.caption: spread the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Serve the chili hot, traditionally with cheese and/or cornbread.
